question_text: What is the measure of angle ABC in the diagram?
image_alt_text: Right triangle ABC with angle A marked as 30 degrees and angle C marked as 60 degrees
hint: Remember that the sum of angles in a triangle equals 180°
solution: Using the triangle angle sum property: 30° + 60° + angle B = 180°. Therefore, angle B = 180° - 30° - 60° = 90°

question_text: What is the area of the shaded region in the figure?
image_alt_text: A square with side length 10cm containing a circle with radius 5cm. The shaded region is the area between the square and circle
hint: Calculate the area of the square and subtract the area of the circle
solution: Area of square = 10² = 100 cm². Area of circle = π × 5² ≈ 78.5 cm². Shaded area = 100 - 78.5 = 21.5 cm²

question_text: Based on the velocity-time graph shown, what is the acceleration of the object?
image_alt_text: A velocity-time graph showing a straight line starting at origin (0,0) and ending at point (10s, 20m/s)
hint: Acceleration is the slope of a velocity-time graph
solution: Acceleration = change in velocity / change in time = (20 - 0) / (10 - 0) = 20/10 = 2 m/s²

question_text: What is the IUPAC name of the compound shown in the structural formula?
image_alt_text: Structural formula showing a carbon chain with CH3-CH2-CH(CH3)-CH2-OH
hint: Number the carbon chain from the end nearest to the functional group
solution: The longest carbon chain has 4 carbons with an OH group at position 1. There is a methyl branch at position 2. Therefore, the name is 2-Methylbutan-1-ol.

question_text: Which part of the cell is labeled 'X' in the diagram?
image_alt_text: Diagram of a plant cell with various organelles labeled. Part X points to the large central structure
hint: This is the largest organelle in a plant cell
solution: Part X points to the central vacuole, which is the large fluid-filled organelle that maintains cell turgor pressure in plant cells.
